title: new Thomas Pynchon novel cover
content:
Here are various drafts of the cover of Thomas Pynchon’s new novel, Inherent Vice, which will be released in a few weeks. Anyone know the titles fonts and whether the final neon is custom or a font itself? Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [inherent-vice\_cover-final.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144218/http:/typophile.com/files/inherent-vice_cover-final.jpg) | 62.43 KB |
| [Inherent-Vice-Pynchon.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144218/http:/typophile.com/files/Inherent-Vice-Pynchon.jpg) | 27.72 KB |
| [inherent-vice\_cover-final2-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144218/http:/typophile.com/files/inherent-vice_cover-final2-1.jpg) | 40.34 KB |
author: Wehwalt

comments.content: I don’t think so in any case.

You’re eyes are always better than mine, Jan.

I just realized in my mind I was really thinking of [FontBureau’s Nobel](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144218/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-nobel/nobel-bold/)

and 2 looks like it could be the Nobel light from FB with the M from Futura light and N of DTL Nobel light with a slight stroke added to FB Nobel and Futura.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144218im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture11_5030.png)
Thanks, guys— I appreciate the effort!

Isn’t the second just Century Gothic?

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel
Sure. Century Gothic. You’re right Martijn.
